section.title: anonymous enum
section.para: Predefined object classes It describes schema of data distribution & protection.

row.entry: OC_BACK_COMPATDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_BACK_COMPAT OC_BACK_COMPAT

entry.para: Object classes with no data protection NB: The first 50 IDs are reserved for backward compatibility

row.entry: OC_TINYDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_TINY OC_TINY

entry.para: Single shard object

row.entry: OC_SMALLDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_SMALL OC_SMALL

entry.para: Object with small number of shards. Number of shards of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_LARGEDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_LARGE OC_LARGE

entry.para: Object with large number of shards. Number of shards of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_MAXDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_MAX OC_MAX

entry.para: Object with maximum number of shards. Number of shards of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_RP_TINYDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_TINY OC_RP_TINY

entry.para: object classes protected by replication Tiny object protected by replication This object class has one redundancy group

row.entry: OC_RP_SMALLDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_SMALL OC_RP_SMALL

entry.para: Replicated object with small number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_RP_LARGEDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_LARGE OC_RP_LARGE

entry.para: Replicated object with large number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_RP_MAXDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_MAX OC_RP_MAX

entry.para: Replicated object with maximum number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_RP_SF_TINYDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_SF_TINY OC_RP_SF_TINY

entry.para: Object classes protected by replication which supports Scalable Fetch (SF) SF classes have more replicas, so they are slower on update, but more scalable on fetch because they have more replicas to serve fetches. Tiny object protected by replication This object class has one redundancy group

row.entry: OC_RP_SF_SMALLDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_SF_SMALL OC_RP_SF_SMALL

entry.para: (SF) Replicated object with small number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_RP_SF_LARGEDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_SF_LARGE OC_RP_SF_LARGE

entry.para: (SF) Replicated object with large number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_RP_SF_MAXDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_SF_MAX OC_RP_SF_MAX

entry.para: (SF) Replicated object with maximum number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_RP_XSFDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_XSF OC_RP_XSF

entry.para: Replicated object class which is extremely scalable for fetch. It has many replicas so it is very slow for update.

row.entry: OC_EC_TINYDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_TINY OC_EC_TINY

entry.para: Object classes protected by erasure code Tiny object protected by EC This object class has one redundancy group

row.entry: OC_EC_SMALLDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_SMALL OC_EC_SMALL

entry.para: EC object with small number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_EC_LARGEDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_LARGE OC_EC_LARGE

entry.para: EC object with large number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_EC_MAXDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_MAX OC_EC_MAX

entry.para: EC object with maximum number of redundancy groups. Number of redundancy groups of the class is chosen by DAOS based on the current size of the pool.

row.entry: OC_S1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_S1 OC_S1

entry.para: Object classes with explicit layout Object classes with explicit layout but no data protection Examples: S1 : shards=1, S2 means shards=2, ... SX : spreading across all targets within the pool

row.entry: OC_RP_2G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_2G1 OC_RP_2G1

entry.para: Replicated object with explicit layout The first number is number of replicas, the number after G stands for number of redundancy Groups.
Examples: 2G1 : 2 replicas group=1 3G2 : 3 replicas groups=2, ... 8GX : 8 replicas, it spreads across all targets within the pool 2-way replicated object classes

row.entry: OC_RP_3G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_3G1 OC_RP_3G1

entry.para: 3-way replicated object classes

row.entry: OC_RP_4G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_4G1 OC_RP_4G1

entry.para: 4-way replicated object classes

row.entry: OC_RP_6G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_6G1 OC_RP_6G1

entry.para: 6-way replicated object classes

row.entry: OC_RP_8G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RP_8G1 OC_RP_8G1

entry.para: 8-way replicated object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_2P1G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_2P1G1 OC_EC_2P1G1

entry.para:
Erasure coded object with explicit layout
the first number is data cells number within a redundancy group
the number after P is parity cells number within a redundancy group
the number after G is number of redundancy Groups.

Examples:
2P1G1: 2+1 EC object with one redundancy group
4P2G8: 4+2 EC object with 8 redundancy groups
8P2G2: 8+2 EC object with 2 redundancy groups
16P2GX: 16+2 EC object spreads across all targets within the pool EC 2+1 object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_2P2G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_2P2G1 OC_EC_2P2G1

entry.para: EC 2+2 object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_4P1G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_4P1G1 OC_EC_4P1G1

entry.para: EC 4+1 object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_4P2G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_4P2G1 OC_EC_4P2G1

entry.para: EC 4+2 object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_8P1G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_8P1G1 OC_EC_8P1G1

entry.para: EC 8+1 object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_8P2G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_8P2G1 OC_EC_8P2G1

entry.para: EC 8+2 object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_16P1G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_16P1G1 OC_EC_16P1G1

entry.para: EC 16+1 object classes

row.entry: OC_EC_16P2G1DAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_EC_16P2G1 OC_EC_16P2G1

entry.para: EC 16+2 object classes

row.entry: OC_RESERVEDDAOS Object Class DAOS Object ClassOC_RESERVED OC_RESERVED

entry.para: Class ID equal or higher than this is reserved

section.para: Definition at line 546 of file daos_obj_class.h.

para.computeroutput: int daos_obj_list_class (daos_handle_t coh, struct daos_oclass_list * list, daos_anchor_t * anchor, daos_event_t * ev)

row.entry: in
coh

entry.para: Container open handle.

row.entry: out
list

entry.para: Sink buffer for returned class list.

row.entry: in,out
anchor

entry.para: Hash anchor for the next call. It should be set to zeroes for the first call. It should not be altered by caller between calls.

row.entry: in
ev

entry.para: Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. Function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 success -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable

section.title: daos_obj_query_class()

para.computeroutput: int daos_obj_query_class (daos_handle_t coh, daos_oclass_id_t cid, struct daos_oclass_attr * attr, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Query attributes of an object class by its ID.

row.entry: in
coh

entry.para: Container open handle.

row.entry: in
cid

entry.para: Class ID to query.

row.entry: out
attr

entry.para: Returned attributes of the object class.

row.entry: in
ev

entry.para: Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 success -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NONEXIST Nonexistent class ID

section.title: daos_obj_register_class()

para.computeroutput: int daos_obj_register_class (daos_handle_t coh, daos_oclass_id_t cid, struct daos_oclass_attr * attr, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Register a new object class in addition to the default ones (see DAOS_OC_*). An object class cannot be unregistered for the time being.

row.entry: in
coh

entry.para: Container open handle.

row.entry: in
cid

entry.para: ID for the new object class.

row.entry: in
attr

entry.para: Attributes for the new object class.

row.entry: in
ev

entry.para: Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. Function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 success -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_EXIST Object class ID already existed

section.title: daos_oclass_id2name()
section.para: Return the object class name given it's ID.

row.entry: in
oc_id

entry.para: Object class ID.

row.entry: out
name

entry.para: buffer for the name of the object class to be copied into it.

section.title: daos_oclass_name2id()
section.para: Return the Object class ID given the object class name in string format.

row.entry: in
name

entry.para: Object class name.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: The Object class ID, 0 / OC_UNKNOWN if unknown.

section.title: daos_oclass_names_list()
section.para: Return the list of object class.

row.entry: in
size

entry.para: length in bytes of str buffer.

row.entry: out
str

entry.para: buffer to get all registered oclass names

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: >= 0 on success and required length of str, -1 if error.

section.title: daos_oclass_nr()
section.para: Return total number of object classes

row.entry: in
opts

entry.para: reserved options
